body_html: The basic question here is whether your poor performance is due to a slow GPU kernel, to inefficiencies in moving data back and forth between CPU and GPU, or something else. If you could use timeline and other profiling tools to track this down on your side, it would be helpful. When data sizes are tiny, GPUs provide no advantage over CPUs. However, if another DNN framework can run this same model on GPU much faster, that's a performance problem we'd like to address.
body_text: The basic question here is whether your poor performance is due to a slow GPU kernel, to inefficiencies in moving data back and forth between CPU and GPU, or something else.   If you could use timeline and other profiling tools to track this down on your side, it would be helpful.   When data sizes are tiny, GPUs provide no advantage over CPUs.  However, if another DNN framework can run this same model on GPU much faster, that's a performance problem we'd like to address.
body: The basic question here is whether your poor performance is due to a slow GPU kernel, to inefficiencies in moving data back and forth between CPU and GPU, or something else.   If you could use timeline and other profiling tools to track this down on your side, it would be helpful.   When data sizes are tiny, GPUs provide no advantage over CPUs.  However, if another DNN framework can run this same model on GPU much faster, that's a performance problem we'd like to address.
